Description: Wallet (?), flat sleeve of plain cotton cloth on a stiff base of strips of palm leaf. The palm placed lengthwise and crosswise and held together with paired cotton threads. The cloth covering, of two pieces of cotton cut on the bias and seamed together down the centre held onto the palm by a network of stretched and couched cotton threads clearly intended to be partly decorative. Around one end, stem stitching in a thicker thread.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), LC1-17 room 2 floor 1
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
